choices.B: All activities of that level are successfully performed
choices.A: An identified subset of the activities of that level can be executed effectively
choices.C: Capability is demonstrated on the most relevant process activities

discussion.content:
B
"Maturity levels are associated with focus areas (i.e., a collection of governance and management objectives and
underlying components) and a certain maturity level is achieved if all the processes contained in the focus area
achieve that particular capability level"

questions.question_text: Which of the following criteria must be met for a process to meet a higher capability level?
Which of the following is a KEY principle associated with the Accountable (A) role of an organizational structure?

discussion.content:
Boards and executive management are typically accountable for governance processes, while management
processes are the domain of senior and middle management

choices.A: Accountability must be approved by the board

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
What enabler describes the key decision-making entities in an organization

The different levels of involvement associated with roles and organizational structure are PRIMARILY divided into:
Which of the following frameworks has been used as a basis for developing guidance for the COBIT governance component of people, skills and competencies?

discussion.content: Answer is B. SFIA and not CSF

choices.B: Skills Framework for the Information Age
